did.abstract: Collection of correspondence, records of committees and organizations, legislation drafts, and research material on the subject of Special Education programs and services, created and used by Lynwood Beekman in his law practice and in drafting of the Michigan Special Education legislation.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Lynwood Beekman (donor no. 10479) in December 2010.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Lynwood Beekman papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Lynwood Beekman is a Lansing, Mich. native and the University of Michigan Law School graduate. Beekman's father, Marvin E. Beekman, was Director of Special Education for Lansing Public Schools. He established the nation's first public school work experience program for the mentally disabled. Later, as the State's Director of Special Education, Marvin E. Beekman guided Michigan to a leadership position in service to the mentally impaired.

Lynwood Beekman's 30-year law career has been largely devoted to the representation of parents and their children with disabilities, over 90 Michigan school districts, and the Michigan Education Association and its members, including teachers, school psychologists, school social workers, bus drivers, paraprofessionals, etc. Beekman served in over 600 matters as a hearing officer and state review officer in three states. He has provided consultative assistance or hearing officer and mediator trainings for 46 states and the Bureau of Indian Affairs. He has also served as a mediator, neutral evaluator, arbitrator, and complaint investigator in over 300 cases, including several matters pending before state and federal courts. He provided counsel to the Michigan Association for Retarded Citizens (ARC), and sought special education programs and services for many impaired residents of State institutions. Beekman collaborated in drafting the Mandatory Special Education Act and revised Special Education Rules, among other important pieces of Special Education legislation. In 1975 Beekman founded the Citizens Alliance to Uphold Special Education and served as its President for 13 years. In 1976 he was appointed by the State Superintendent of Public Instruction to the Special Education Task Force that was primarily drafting of the new or revised Special Education Rules. For six years Beekman served as the Chairperson of the State Board of Education's Special Education Advisory Committee. Beekman also served as Chairperson of the State Board of Education's Special Education Delivery System Task Force.

scopecontent.p: The collection documents the work of Lynwood Beekman and legislative history of Special Education in Michigan. The papers are arranged in five series roughly following Beekman's original arrangement of papers and records. The collection consists primarily of records of the Department of Education and its committees and task forces, as well as Special Education organizations. Also included numerous drafts of legislation, generously peppered with Beekman's scrupulous handwritten notes, and working files.

did.unittitle: Mandatory Special Education and Life Services

scopecontent.p: The Mandatory Special Education and Life Services series contains records of task forces and organizations that worked on drafting and revising the Mandatory Special Education Act. Records include correspondence and memoranda, questionnaires, recommendations and reports, minutes of meetings, drafts, discussion points and responses, report reviews and analysis.

did.unittitle: Special Education Delivery System Task Force
Intermediate School District Plan for Delivery of Special Education and Services (ISD Plan) 1980-1992 (scattered)
Project to Assure Services for Handicapped Citizens (PASH) 1984-1987
Five-Year State Plan for Independent Living Programs and Services in the state of Michigan (State Independent Living Council, 1992)

scopecontent.p: The Michigan Department of Education series contains material related to MDE's legislative work in the area of Special Education, namely administrative rules, procedures related to hearings and hearing officers training, non-compliance and disputes, and regulations, and records of several MDE committees and workgroups on special education. Records include correspondence and memoranda, texts and discussion of proposals and legislation drafts and final versions.

did.unittitle: Michigan Dept. of Management and Budget 1991, 1996-1997
Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) Implementation Agreement 1997-1998

scopecontent.p: The Special Education Organizations and Cases series contains records of several Michigan organizations advocating Special Education in Michigan and, and materials of court cases. The series contains records of Michigan Association for Retarded Citizens (MARC), Special Education Service Area (SESA), and Special Education Advisory Committee (SEAC). Included here are correspondence and memoranda, policies, and court materials.

The Working Files series contains materials on various topics used by Lynwood Beekman throughout his career. Material is organized in approximate chronological order. Files include correspondence, memoranda, articles, notes, statistical data, etc. Also included are two audiotapes of the State Board of Education meeting of April 18, 1979, with partial transcription.

did.unittitle: History of Special Education in Michigan 1970s-1980s (scattered)
Study of Transportation of Medically Fragile Children, 1989
Medication and physical therapy in schools 1983, 1987, 1996
State Board of Education meeting April 18, 1979
Guidelines for Special Education Programs and Services in Michigan (Michigan Department of Education) 1974
Guidelines for Special Education Programs and Services in Michigan Rev. ed. (Michigan Department of Education) 1977
Alternatives to Litigation: The Necessity for Parent Consultation, [1977]
State Board of Education Recommendations for Legislative Action 1979
Special Education Rules (Michigan State Board of Education) 1980, 1982-1983
Request for Proposal, Fiscal Year 1980/1981 (State of Michigan Developmental Disabilities Program, Michigan Department of Mental Health)
The Michigan School Aid Act [of 1979] Compiled and Appendices 1998

scopecontent.p: The Marvin E. Beekman series contains papers and photographs of Lynwood Beekman's father. Included in the series are materials on the subject of history of special education in Lansing, Mich. and miscellaneous items. Photographs in the series depict Marvin E. Beekman's retirement event.

did.unittitle: History of Special Education in Lansing, Mich 1955-1967 (scattered)
Basic Driver Education by Bouner, Gutshall, and Kenel (Lansing, Mich.: Special Education Pub.), 1966
